L9yjr3.description: Heading for the Learn more dialog

LGSw+f.defaultMessage: All apprentices will be supported by carefully selected peer partners and mentors. Apprentices will also be invited to join an Indigenous Apprenticeship Network, where there will be opportunities to connect with other Indigenous employees in the Government of Canada, and with other Indigenous apprentices who are participating in this program.
LGSw+f.description: Learn more dialog question two paragraph two

O0z6Ym.description: Heading for section about who the program is for

OcIvN1.defaultMessage: Upon successful completion of the program, it is hoped that apprentices will consider remaining with the Government of Canada.

Qt9Q8k.description: Learn more dialog question two heading

S/PXt/.defaultMessage: Opportunities exist in a large number of departments and agencies across the Government of Canada. The program will attempt to match apprentices with opportunities that best align with their interests.
S/PXt/.description: Learn more dialog question nine paragraph one

SnnuD+.defaultMessage: We’ll invite you to create a profile which will be saved and submitted as your actual application.
SnnuD+.description: How it works, step 2 content sentence 2

TFeQL2.description: Link to the homepage for indigenous apprenticeship program.

U8bLT7.description: heading for how the indigenous talent portal will work

UDHGGA.defaultMessage: Soon, applicants will be able to apply using an online, interactive tool that will be available on this website. Here’s what we’re working on:
UDHGGA.description: Description of how the indigenous talent portal will work

UQlyXu.defaultMessage: Apprentices will experience a combination of on-the-job learning and online training in one or more information technology areas. Apprentices are expected to demonstrate their interest and passion for technology by being willing to observe, learn, and practice new skills that are developed over the course of the program. On average, an apprentice will spend four days a week doing hands-on learning, while the fifth day of the week will be dedicated to personal and professional development through online training and through other developmental training opportunities.
UQlyXu.description: Learn more dialog question eight paragraph one

WDRWcu.defaultMessage: Do I have to move to Ottawa or to a specific location to participate in this program?
WDRWcu.description: Learn more dialog question six heading

XS21o1.defaultMessage: You bet! As employees of the Government of Canada, all apprentices will be entitled to vacation leave, sick leave, and family related leave. After six months, apprentices will also have access to medical and dental insurance coverage for themselves and their dependents, in addition to becoming a member of the federal public service pension plan.
XS21o1.description: Learn more dialog question five paragraph one

Xhfkfg.defaultMessage: Address the great demand for Indigenous talent in IT.

YGM/D5.defaultMessage: The program is 24 months in length, with supports available to apprentices during their time in the program.
YGM/D5.description: Learn more dialog question two paragraph one

b09U1u.defaultMessage: At the end of their 24-month term, apprentices will have marketable and in-demand certifications and skills, as well as the confidence necessary to contribute as part of Canada’s digital workforce, both within and outside the federal public service.
b09U1u.description: First paragraph what will you learn at the program

cNXORI.defaultMessage: Be a minimum of 16 years old

cYq1Dp.defaultMessage: Apprentices who are involved in the program say that it is “life-changing”, that it represents “a chance to have a better life through technology”, and that “there are no barriers to succeeding in this program”.

ce892L.description: Heading for the apply now dialog

dDHy5d.defaultMessage: Apprentices follow a 24-month structured program consisting of a mix of on-the-job learning and formal training.
dDHy5d.description: First paragraph what will you learn at the program

dgG8md.defaultMessage: What education requirements exist – can I apply if I don't have a college diploma or university degree?
dgG8md.description: Learn more dialog question twelve heading

fF4Ex+.defaultMessage: The Indigenous Talent Portal was built for the Indigenous community, by the Indigenous community.

fvsYkj.defaultMessage: What will I learn in this apprenticeship?
fvsYkj.description: What applicants will learn sections heading

hSmKjD.defaultMessage: Absolutely! Your time is valuable. Apprentices will receive pay and benefits as employees of the Government of Canada. Apprentices will earn between $29.00 and $33.00 per hour to start, with the exact salary to be determined at the time of hire and dependent upon the collective agreement in place within the hiring organization. Apprentices will be employed full-time, for a total of 37.5 hours per week.
hSmKjD.description: Learn more dialog question four paragraph one

hdBTPI.defaultMessage: All required computer equipment (laptop, mouse, monitor, phone) and training material will be provided at no-cost. If a person chooses to work from home, the cost of internet access will be the responsibility of the apprentice.
hdBTPI.description: Learn more dialog question ten paragraph one

jA4kuU.description: Learn more dialog question four heading

jyQi0m.defaultMessage: If you are First Nations, Inuk, or Métis, and you live in Canada, then you can apply to become an apprentice in this program.
jyQi0m.description: Learn more dialog question on paragraph one

khChKa.defaultMessage: The Program is for First Nations, Inuit, and Métis peoples. If you are First Nations, an Inuk, or Métis, and if you have a passion for technology, then this Program is for you!
khChKa.description: First paragraph about who the program is for

kiH9nz.description: Button text displayed for Indigenous languages dropdown

mfBsJY.defaultMessage: What will apprentices have to do as part of the program?
mfBsJY.description: Learn more dialog question eight heading

nzcwrW.defaultMessage: Apprentices will be partnered with a peer to facilitate job shadowing and supervised work, and they are assigned a mentor who provides experienced counsel and guidance over the course of the program.
nzcwrW.description: First paragraph what will you learn at the program

osGGIt.defaultMessage: IT Apprenticeship Program for Indigenous Peoples + The Indigenous Talent Portal
osGGIt.description: heading for indigenous talent portal section

p19YJ2.defaultMessage: Apply today to start your journey to a career in Information Technology.

p2sBh3.description: Learn more dialog question one heading

pPOGwF.defaultMessage: Are First Nations (status or non-status), Inuit, or Métis

pWoAv0.defaultMessage: The IT Apprenticeship Program for Indigenous Peoples is a Government of Canada initiative specifically for First Nations, Inuit, and Métis peoples. It is pathway to employment in the federal public service for Indigenous peoples who have a passion for Information Technology (IT).

pkFLpT.defaultMessage: If you have an interest and a passion for technology and self-identify as Indigenous, then this program is for you.
pkFLpT.description: Learn more dialog question seven paragraph one

q5FQbu.description: Heading for a coming soon section

qZvV7b.defaultMessage: IT Apprenticeship Program for Indigenous Peoples. Apply today to get started on your IT career journey.
qZvV7b.description: Homepage title for Indigenous Apprenticeship Program

rQ61eh.defaultMessage: Allow for data and feedback to be collected and leveraged to improve the service.

rz21yp.defaultMessage: Will apprentices be entitled to any benefits?
rz21yp.description: Learn more dialog question five heading

sycoGU.defaultMessage: Not necessarily. Most apprenticeship opportunities can be done by working from home, as long as there is an internet connection. Some positions do have a location-specific requirement. We value the importance of family and community, and we encourage individuals to join our family without having to leave theirs, and to become part of our community while remaining in theirs. Talk to your hiring manager about your situation/preference and we will do our best to work with you to find a suitable solution.
sycoGU.description: Learn more dialog question six paragraph one

t2Q+IG.description: Button text for returning to default language from Indigenous language

uJ1rk3.defaultMessage: There are three distinct groups of Indigenous peoples recognized in the Canadian constitution. You will be asked to confirm which Indigenous group(s) you belong to via the Indigenous Peoples Self-Declaration Form.
uJ1rk3.description: How it works, step 1 content paragraph 2

uoX7ou.defaultMessage: This page is available in Indigenous languages
uoX7ou.description: Text displayed as label for Indigenous languages selector

wHWE3M.defaultMessage: It is a platform designed to host employment opportunities for Indigenous peoples in a way that recognizes and showcases their unique talents, ideas, skills and passion.

wgIThY.defaultMessage: Have a high school diploma or equivalent (a GED)

wqwPhL.defaultMessage: By valuing and focusing on a person’s potential, rather than on their educational attainment level, the Program removes one of the biggest barriers that exists when it comes to employment within the digital economy. The Program has been developed by, with, and for Indigenous peoples from across Canada. Its design incorporates the preferences and needs of Indigenous learners while recognizing the importance of community.

yZMQ6j.defaultMessage: We want to learn about you and about your interest/passion in the area of IT!
yZMQ6j.description: How it works, step 2 content sentence 1

zlYw3Z.defaultMessage: Submit your Profile as your Application
